entry.summary:
Attorneys for fallen cryptocurrency tycoon Sam Bankman-Fried are requesting his temporary release from a Brooklyn jail, arguing that limited access to trial evidence and computers is impeding his ability to prepare his defense.
Sam Bankman-Fried‚Äôs Lawyers Urge Temporary Release Amid Trial Challenges
In a letter to federal judge Lewis Kaplan filed Friday, Bankman-Fried‚Äôs lawyers Mark Cohen and Christian Everdell claimed the FTX founder is unable to adequately review discovery materials on the provided laptop and internet connection at the Metropolitan Detention Center. ‚ÄúMr. Bankman-Fried was only able to load one document from the database to review. The attorneys further wrote:
Effectively, Mr. Bankman-Fried had no access to the internet for the entire 5-hour period.

entry.summary:
James Howells, a bitcoin enthusiast who misplaced 7,500 bitcoin (BTC) in a South Wales landfill, is gearing up to take legal action against the local city council for barring his efforts to unearth the missing hard drive from 2013. This former IT professional, now 38, has been at odds with Newport City Council for ten long years, rallying a 16-person crew to help retrieve the drive, now valued at $194 million.
Howells‚Äô Legal Team Gives Newport City Council New Demands
A Telegraph report reveals that James Howells is gearing up to legally challenge the local city council in South Wales, which has denied his team permission to unearth a hard drive he suspects is buried beneath the landfill. entry.title: G20 To Establish Unified Crypto Regulation, Urges Countries To Share Information
entry.summary:
Due to the ever-changing nature of cryptocurrency technology, it has always been subject to regulatory amendments around the globe. The G20, a group of 20 developed economies, has opted for a unified approach to design a comprehensive crypto rule book to address this issue.¬†
In the G20 summit held in New Delhi, leaders from around the globe have agreed to establish a comprehensive crypto framework. In order to expand the digital assets transparency, the approved consensus declaration includes sharing of information between countries.
The consensus declaration signed by G20 leaders reads:
We call for the swift implementation of the Crypto-Asset Reporting Framework (CARF) and amendments to the CRS [Common Reporting Standard]. We ask the Global Forum on Transparency and Exchange of I‚Ä¶

entry.title: Vitalik Buterin‚Äôs X Account Hacked to Promote Crypto Scam
entry.summary:
The X account of Ethereum founder Vitalik Buterin has apparently suffered a breach by scammers spreading phishing links. The attack, which manifested itself in the form of a post offering free digital collectibles, has allegedly resulted in the loss of over $690,000 for those who fell for the fraud.
Scammers Lure Victims With Phishing Post From Vitalik Buterin‚Äôs X Profile
The X (formerly Twitter) account of Vitalik Buterin, an influential voice in the crypto space, has been compromised by fraudsters seeking to drain victims‚Äô wallets. The post pretended to ‚Äúcelebrate Proto-Danksharding coming to Ethereum‚Äù with a collection of ‚Äúfree‚Äù non-fungible tokens (NFTs).
On Saturday, Vitalik‚Äôs father warned on X about the malicious tweet that has since been deleted. ‚ÄúDisregard this post, app‚Ä¶

entry.title: What Are Smart Contracts? Unpacking Today‚Äôs Digital Agreements
entry.summary:
In the digital currency realm, smart contracts have enhanced the financial industry through tokenization, decentralized finance (defi) and other agreements in the form of self-executing code. But how exactly do they work? What benefits do they offer? Here‚Äôs a concise overview of smart contracts and their profound effect on trust and collaboration in our interconnected society.
Smart Contract Origins
If you keep up with cryptocurrency news you‚Äôve likely heard of ‚Äúsmart contracts.‚Äù Smart contracts, in their current form, are self-executing agreements housed on a blockchain.
Fundamentally, the ‚Äúsmart‚Äù in smart contracts stems from automation, while the ‚Äúcontract‚Äù denotes a binding agreement or function that runs automatically. The idea of smart contracts was first posited by American co‚Ä¶

entry.title: What Are Stablecoins? A Simple Explanation of the Digital Asset Bridging Crypto and Fiat
entry.summary:
Stablecoins occupy a unique space within the realm of finance, straddling the worlds of traditional and cryptocurrency finance. These digital assets aim to achieve price stability by tethering their market value to external references such as fiat money. Stablecoins blend the characteristics of cryptocurrencies with the stability of traditional assets like the U.S. dollar or commodities such as gold, resulting in digital tokens with limited volatility. By stabilizing their purchasing power, stablecoins offer a level of reliability currently absent in pure, decentralized cryptocurrencies. Let‚Äôs delve into what stablecoins are, the various types available, and their origins.
Stablecoins: Bridging Crypto and Fiat for Price Stability
Today, the bustling stablecoin ecosystem boasts an impre‚Ä¶

entry.title: Turkish Crypto Exchange Boss Gets 11,196 Years in Prison
entry.summary:
The CEO of collapsed Turkish crypto exchange Thodex has been sentenced to 11,196 years, 10 months, and 15 days in prison. He purportedly absconded with more than $2 billion in cryptocurrency belonging to more than 400,000 customers. The court found his crypto trading platform to be a criminal organization.
Thodex Chief Sentenced to 11,196 Years in Prison
The CEO of collapsed Turkish cryptocurrency exchange Thodex, Faruk Fatih √ñzer, was reportedly sentenced to 11,196 years, 10 months and 15 days in prison on Thursday. AFP reported that prosecutors had requested a prison sentence of 40,562 years for the 29-year-old crypto exchange boss.
√ñzer was found guilty of various charges including fraud, leading a criminal organization, and money laundering. The court also found Thodex to be a criminal organization and that √ñzer acted with fraudulent intent from the beginning. In addition, √ñzer‚Äôs sister Serap and brother Guven were found guilty of the same charges.
The Thodex CEO refuted the finding that his intentions were criminal. He told the court he would ‚Äúnot have acted so amateurishly‚Äù if that was the case, according to state-run news outlet Anadolu Agency. The publication quoted him as saying:
I am smart enough to lead any institution on Earth ‚Ä¶ That is evident in this company I established at the age of 22.
Thodex, founded in 2017, was one of the largest crypto exchanges in Turkey before it abruptly collapsed in April 2021. The platform went offline and √ñzer disappeared, leaving over 400,000 customers unable to access their cryptocurrency holdings reportedly worth a total of $2 billion.
√ñzer was arrested in Albania in August last year following an Interpol-issued red notice. After a lengthy legal process, he was extradited back to Turkey in June and found guilty of money laundering, fraud, and organized crime.
What are your thoughts on the crypto exchange CEO receiving a prison sentence of over 11,196 years? Let us know in the comments section below.

entry.title: SEC Greenlights Nasdaq‚Äôs First AI-Powered Order Type
entry.summary:
The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has approved a new artificial intelligence (AI)-powered order type for Nasdaq‚Äôs stock exchange. This marks the first AI order type approved for an exchange. Nasdaq says the latest technology aims to improve efficiency and performance on its platform.
Nasdaq‚Äôs AI-Powered Trading Mechanism Gets SEC Nod
Nasdaq announced on Friday that it received approval from the SEC to launch its ‚ÄúDynamic Midpoint Extended Life Order.‚Äù This new order type uses artificial intelligence (AI) to match buyers and sellers who plan to hold stocks for longer periods.
Traditionally, Nasdaq matched buyers and sellers using set waiting periods. But the company found using AI to adjust waiting times based on current market conditions improved results. The AI-power‚Ä¶

entry.title: IMF, FSB Lay Out Roadmap To ‚ÄòAddress Risks‚Äô Posed by Crypto to Financial Stability
entry.summary: The international bodies warned of threats to monetary policy and financial stability if crypto adoption becomes widespread.

entry.title: Vitalik Buterin Pushes for ‚ÄòPrivacy Pools‚Äô to Balance Anonymity With Regulatory Compliance
entry.summary: A research paper co-authored by the Ethereum co-founder explores a privacy-preserving blockchain protocol that complies with global regulations.

entry.title: How Mino Games is Using Artificial Intelligence
entry.summary: Mino Games CEO Sasha McKinnon tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how the studio's upcoming game Dimensionals will use real-time AI.

entry.title: INTERVIEW: How Will Aurory Use NFTs and Crypto?
entry.summary: Michael Natoli, Aurory's Head of Marketing and Business Development, tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how the Aurory games will use NFTs and crypto and shares the studio's broader stance on the tech.

entry.title: Google Cloud's James Tromans on the Intersection of AI and Web3
entry.summary: Google's Global Head of Google Cloud for Web3 James Tromans sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson to discuss how AI can help Web3 companies come to market faster and the real value of Web3 tools.

entry.title: Mastering NFT Trading - Degen U
entry.summary: Take Degen U's new course, Mastering NFT Trading, and earn an on-chain certificate. A top instructor will help you identify trends, seize the right moment to trade, weed out scams‚Äîand have fun while doing it!

entry.title: Space Nation CEO on Working With 'Independence Day' Director Roland Emmerich
entry.summary: Jerome Wu, CEO of Space Nation, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the upcoming Space Nation Online game in development and shares details on Space Nation Cofounder Roland Emmerich's role in the project.

entry.title: GAME REVIEW: Champions Arena from Gala Games
entry.summary: Champions Arena is a turn-based fantasy RPG from Gala Games, where characters can become NFTs and crypto can be used to purchase gems, one of the game's synthetic currencies. Decrypt's Kate Irwin takes us inside the game for her thoughts on the fun, mobile-first title.

entry.title: Apex Legends Voice Actor Ben Prendergast on the Future of Gaming
entry.summary: Voice actor Ben Prendergast, who's voiced characters in games like Apex Legends and God of War Ragnarok, shares his opinions on the tech space's history of "bubbles" and whether blockchain gaming has a future.

entry.title: The future of AI Stardom and Robotics with SingularityNET COO Janet Adams and Desdemona
entry.summary: In this interview, SingularityNET COO Janet Adams explains the intricate details that went into creating the Desdemona robot AI from Hanson Robotics and future plans for the AI Diva.

entry.title: Crypto a 'No-Brainer' for Video Games, Says Mino Games CEO
entry.summary: Mino Games CEO Sasha MacKinnon, developer of the upcoming Dimensionals game, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the studio's approach to digital collectibles.

entry.title: Michael Wagner's 'Controversial Take' on Crypto in Games
entry.summary: At Solana's PlayGG, Star Atlas CEO Michael Wagner shares his "controversial take" on crypto in games, shares the challenges of developing the upcoming scifi game, and how crypto's volatility has changed his perspective with Decrypt's Jason Nelson.

entry.title: Interview: Angelic CEO on Building the Sci-Fi RPG on Solana and Ethereum
entry.summary: Angelic is a sci-fi roleplay game in development that will be free-to-play and offer optional, opt-in crypto features on Solana and Ethereum and a governance token. Metaverse Game Studios CEO and Founder Erkan Bayol tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how he sees AAA traditional games as Angelic's main competitors and shares his vision for the game.

entry.title: Apex Legends Voice Actor on AI's Impact on Video Games
entry.summary: Ben Prendergast is an actor who has voiced characters like Apex Legends' Fuse, God of War Ragnarok's Tyr, and Patroclus in Hades. But as debates swirl around the use of artificial intelligence in entertainment in light of the SAG-AFTRA and WGA strikes, Prendergast gives Decrypt's Kate Irwin his honest take on the potential use of AI actors in games.

entry.title: Star Atlas CEO on Developing an MMO Game
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson speaks with Star Atlas Founder and CEO Michael Wagner about the MMO game's approach to development, marketing, and blockchain integrations.

entry.title: Aurory's Origin Story: How JRPGs Inspired the Games
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson talks to Aurory's Head of Marketing and Business Development Michael Natoli about the origins of the Aurory crypto games at the Solana PlayGG event.
